archetype_name: Family Weekend Advanced: South African Braai & Potjie
name: Peri-Peri Butterflied Chicken Braai with Oven Roosterkoek and Chakalaka
description: Butterflied chicken braaied over medium coals with a peri-peri baste, served with oven-baked roosterkoek, warm chakalaka, and fire-grilled corn. A classic South African feast with Portuguese heat notes.
prep_steps: Light a two-zone braai fire: medium heat on one side, cooler side for indirect cooking.
Preheat oven to 200°C for the roosterkoek.
In a bowl, mix peri peri sauce, olive oil, minced garlic, paprika, chilli flakes, salt, and black pepper to make a baste.
Pat the butterflied chicken dry and lightly season with salt and black pepper.
Prepare roosterkoek mix per pack directions; knead, rest, and shape into 8–10 rolls on a floured board if directed.
Husk corn and rub with a little olive oil.
Open chakalaka can/jar and have it ready for heating.
cook_steps: Set the shaped roosterkoek on a baking tray; bake at 200°C until puffed and golden, 18–25 minutes (timing per mix). Keep warm.
Place butterflied chicken skin-side up on the cool side of the grill. Brush with peri-peri baste. Cover with lid and cook indirectly for 25 minutes.
Flip chicken skin-side down over medium heat for 6–8 minutes to crisp skin. Move back to indirect side, baste again, and cook 15–25 minutes more until juices run clear (thickest part 74°C).
While chicken finishes, grill corn over direct heat, turning until charred in spots, 10–12 minutes.
Warm chakalaka in a small pot on the grill or in the oven, 5–10 minutes, stirring once.
Rest chicken 10 minutes on a board, then brush with any remaining baste.
Serve carved chicken with roosterkoek, warm chakalaka, and grilled corn. Add butter to corn and season with salt and black pepper.
